intro: Bouea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bouea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, round, and have a mildly sweet, tangy flavor. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
